title: Asthma Predictive Index (API)
description: Determines likelihood of pediatric patients developing childhood asthma in children ≤3 years old with recurrent wheezing episodes.

parameters.name: wheezing_episodes
parameters.description: Number of wheezing episodes per year

parameters.name: family_history_asthma
parameters.description: Family history (parent) with asthma - Major criterion

parameters.name: eczema_diagnosis
parameters.description: Patient diagnosed with eczema (atopic dermatitis) - Major criterion

parameters.name: air_allergen_sensitivity
parameters.description: Patient diagnosed with sensitivity to allergens in the air (positive skin prick tests or blood tests) - Minor criterion

parameters.name: wheezing_apart_from_colds
parameters.description: Wheezing present apart from colds - Minor criterion

parameters.name: eosinophils_over_4_percent
parameters.description: Greater than 4% blood eosinophils - Minor criterion

ranges.interpretation: 77% chance of diagnosed active asthma. Requires ≥3 wheezing episodes per year AND either 1 major criterion OR 2 minor criteria.
59% chance of diagnosed asthma. Requires <3 wheezing episodes per year AND either 1 major criterion OR 2 minor criteria.
Less than 3% chance of asthma diagnosis. Does not meet criteria for positive stringent or loose classification.

classifications.interpretation: 77% chance of diagnosed active asthma. Requires ≥3 wheezing episodes per year AND either 1 major criterion OR 2 minor criteria.
59% chance of diagnosed asthma. Requires <3 wheezing episodes per year AND either 1 major criterion OR 2 minor criteria.
Less than 3% chance of asthma diagnosis. Does not meet criteria for positive stringent or loose classification.

references: Castro-Rodríguez JA, Holberg CJ, Wright AL, Martinez FD. A clinical index to define risk of asthma in young children with recurrent wheezing. Am J Respir Crit Care Med. 2000;162(4 Pt 1):1403-6.

Leonardi NA, Spycher BD, Strippoli MP, Frey U, Silverman M, Kuehni CE. Validation of the Asthma Predictive Index and comparison with simpler clinical prediction rules. J Allergy Clin Immunol. 2011;127(6):1466-72.e6.
Castro-Rodriguez JA. The Asthma Predictive Index: early diagnosis of asthma. Curr Opin Allergy Clin Immunol. 2011;11:157–161.
formula: Major criteria: Family history of asthma, Eczema diagnosis. Minor criteria: Air allergen sensitivity, Wheezing apart from colds, >4% eosinophils. Positive stringent: ≥3 wheezing episodes + (1 major OR 2 minor). Positive loose: <3 wheezing episodes + (1 major OR 2 minor). Negative: Does not meet positive criteria.
notes: This score applies to pediatric patients ≤3 years old with recurrent wheezing episodes
The API was created to identify children who may develop asthma during school years
There is also a modified asthma predictive index (mAPI) version which adds food allergies as an additional criterion
Air allergen sensitivity is demonstrated through positive skin prick tests or blood tests to allergens like dust mites, mold, weeds, etc.
